without*

I think the spoiler discussion goes something along these lines: a casual viewer consumes some kinda media, right? They don't want any spoilers whatsoever, so they can have their very unique perspective. Then they watch things over and over again and see certain tropes and patterns, they lean more towards the critique-ish side of consuming media. That's when one values spoilers more, so they navigate the ocean of consumable works of culture easier.

But then, once you've grasped the tropes, you kinda want to ensure the elements of surprise are in position before you can validate your point. It goes full circle -- you once again value no-spoilers at all, but for different reasons: you want to think outside the box.
